visuals.title: Conjugate Symmetry: X_{−k} = X_k* for Real Signals
visuals.description: For real-valued x(t), the Fourier coefficients satisfy X_{−k} = X_k*. This means |X_{−k}| = |X_k| and ∠X_{−k} = −∠X_k.

visuals.title: Magnitude (Even) and Phase (Odd) for a Real Signal
visuals.description: The magnitude spectrum is symmetric about k=0. The phase spectrum is anti-symmetric.

visuals.title: Even Signal: x(t) = x(−t)
visuals.description: An even signal is symmetric about t=0. Its Fourier coefficients are purely real — no imaginary part.

visuals.title: Even Signal Spectrum: X_k Is Purely Real
visuals.description: For an even signal, X_k = X_k* = X_{−k}, so X_k is real. All phase angles are 0 or π.

visuals.title: Odd Signal: x(t) = −x(−t)
visuals.description: An odd signal is anti-symmetric about t=0. Its Fourier coefficients are purely imaginary.

visuals.title: Odd Signal Spectrum: X_k Is Purely Imaginary
visuals.description: For an odd signal, X_k = −X_{−k} and X_k is purely imaginary. No cosine terms in the TFS.

visuals.title: Half-Period Integration: Exploit Symmetry to Simplify
visuals.description: For even/odd signals, you only need to integrate over half a period and double the result (with appropriate sign).

visuals.title: Symmetry Summary Table
visuals.description: Real → conjugate symmetric. Real+Even → real+even coefficients. Real+Odd → purely imaginary+odd coefficients.

visuals.title: Any Signal = Even Part + Odd Part
visuals.description: x_e(t) = [x(t)+x(−t)]/2 (even part), x_o(t) = [x(t)−x(−t)]/2 (odd part). Every signal decomposes uniquely.

visuals.title: Interactive: Explore Symmetry Properties
visuals.description: Toggle between even, odd, and general signals. Watch the coefficients change between real, imaginary, and complex.
